title: Ticket #6806: Non-qmgmt code shouldn't mess with Q_SOCK
description: Several command handlers in the schedd temporarily set Q_SOCK via [un]setQSock() calls so that they can use OwnerCheck() to see if the authenticated user is allowed to modify certain jobs in the queue. Q_SOCK is meant to be the connection information for the QMGMT command. If we're ever going to allow asynchronous handling of QMGMT commands, then these modifications of Q_SOCK can muck things up. And they're completely unnecessary. The callers can use OwnerCheck2(), which doesn't reference Q_SOCK.
